title: 【翻訳失敗】Many Game Devs Reject AI in Gaming
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: It appears as though the divide between game developers jumping head-first into generative AI and those who oppose it is growing yet again. While brands like EA, Ubisoft, and Xbox are leaning further into the tech, several smaller and indie studios have recently gone on the record to state their displeasure with generative AI and its use in games. In a recent turn Larian Studios, of Baldur's Gate fame, has announced that it will no longer be relying on generative AI for concept art or in-game assets for its upcoming Divinity game. The studio's CEO, however, clarified in a Reddit AMA that he still sees some potential use for AI in optimizing workflows and trying to "improve the speed with which we can try things out." The development team that worked on Bandai Namco's Code Vein 2 also confirmed in an interview with PCGamesN that there would be no generative AI in Code Vein 2, citing cohesiveness as part of the justification for avoiding the tech. The game's producer, Keita Iizuka, also commented that the team is "creating a very original world" and because they "value art style" and the aesthetic of the game. This extends to publishers, too. In a recent interview with Kotaku, Tim Bender, CEO of Hooded Horse, the publisher behind games like Manor Lords and Endless Legend 2, has officially banned AI from the company as a policy. The CEO said "It is now written into our contracts if we're publishing the game, 'no f**king AI assets.'" Bender also touched on using generative AI in early development or to generate placeholder art, expressing concern that developers could easily fall into the same trap as Sandbox Interactive did with Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, which ultimately resulted in the game being stripped of its Indie Game Awards Game of the Year award.

title: 【翻訳失敗】Thermalright Intros Frost Tower 140 Dual Fin-Stack CPU Cooler
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: Thermalright today introduced the Frost Tower 140, a premium dual fin-stack CPU cooler that is designed to offer cooling performance on par with 240 mm AIOs, but with less clutter. The cooler comes in three trims—all black (including black fins and heat pipes); all white (including white fins and heat pipes), and natural color (chrome fins and nickel-plated copper heat pipes). The FT140 is one of the larger dual fin-stack coolers in the market, measuring 140 mm x 146 mm x 158 mm (WxDxH, including fans). It uses seven 6 mm-thick heat pipes that make indirect contact with the CPU over a C1100 copper base. There are two fans included with this cooler, a 140 mm TL-N14DW-R7, and a 120 mm TL-N12W-R9, arranged in a push-pull configuration. The 120 mm is positioned as an intake "push" fan, while the 140 mm is positioned between the two fin-stacks as a "pull" fan. Both fans feature double ball-bearings. The 120 mm fan turns at up to 2,400 RPM, pushing up to 83.35 CFM of airflow at 2.95 mm H₂O static pressure, while the 140 mm fan turns at up to 1,850 RPM, pushing up to 120 CFM at 2.4 mm H₂O. At top speeds, they put out 33.3 dBA and 36.25 dBA noise, respectively. Both fans feature premium liquid crystal polymer impellers, noise dampening rings, and silicone mounts. The cooler comes with Thermalright's SS2 all-metal mounting system. Among the CPU socket types supported are AM5, AM4, LGA1851, LGA1700, and LGA1200/115x.

title: 【翻訳失敗】Here's What's New in iOS 26.3 So Far
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: Apple today seeded the second beta of iOS 26.3, nearly a month after the first beta. So far, the update includes a couple of new features for iPhones. iOS 15.3 through iOS 18.3 were all released in late January over the years, so it is thereby likely that iOS 26.3 will be released towards the end of this month as well. The update is compatible with the iPhone 11 series and newer. Below, we recap what is new in the iOS 26.3 beta so far. iPhone to Android Transfer Tool iOS 26.3 makes it easier for iPhone users to switch to an Android device. A new tool allows you to place your iPhone next to an Android device to wirelessly transfer photos, messages, notes, apps, and more. You can also transfer your phone number. In the iOS 26.3 beta, the new tool can be found in the Settings app, under General → Transfer or Reset ‌iPhone‌ → Transfer to Android. It is available worldwide. Notification Forwarding in EU In the EU, iOS 26.3 introduces both a Notification Forwarding feature and AirPods-like proximity pairing for third-party accessories like earbuds and smartwatches. Apple was required to make these changes to comply with the EU's Digital Markets Act. More Starting with iOS 26.3, there is a dedicated section for Weather wallpapers, with three preset options available to choose from. To access them, tap and hold on the Lock Screen and tap on the plus sign in the bottom-right corner of the screen. February is Black History Month, and iOS 26.3 will likely include the 2026 version of Apple's annual Black Unity wallpaper. Apple also typically releases a new Black Unity Sport Loop for the Apple Watch, and a matching Unity Rhythm watch face. iOS 26.1 introduced a Background Security Improvement feature that is designed to provide security updates for Safari, WebKit, and some other system items between iOS software updates. Apple has been testing the feature with updates such as "iOS 26.3 (a)" and "iOS 26.3 (b)," but they do not actually contain any security fixes. Additional new features and bug fixes may be added in later beta versions of iOS 26.3. Overall, though, it will likely be a relatively minor update. content: Apple's retail store in Santa Rosa, California will be moving from the Santa Rosa Plaza shopping mall to the open-air Montgomery Village shopping plaza later this month. Apple Santa Rosa Plaza The new store at Montgomery Village will be holding its grand opening on Friday, January 23, at 12 p.m. local time, according to Apple's website. Apple's existing store at the Santa Rosa Plaza opened in 2004. Elsewhere in California, Apple continues to renovate its store in Carlsbad, north of San Diego. Apple has a temporary location there, at 1925 Calle Barcelona. Apple is also operating out of a temporary store at the South Coast Plaza shopping mall in Costa Mesa, south of Los Angeles, while it renovates its original location there.
